intro: Alectra hippocrepandra, commonly known as the redstem false nettle, is a herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its stems are reddish and hairy, and it often grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and streambanks. Alectra hippocrepandra is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and its role in supporting local insect populations.
